founding_conditions.capital: Access to up to $15M via venture/angel capital if the opportunity is clean. $8-10M readily accessible; up to $15M for compelling physical/production plays. VC/angel appetite confirmed shifting toward hard-tech/robotics/physical-economy (a16z American Dynamism, BlackRock overweight industrials, JPM supercycle broadening, Goldman $500B+ AI capex).
founding_conditions.team: 2 founders -- ML/AI Masters (Georgia Tech) + operator (Argentina native, US resident)
founding_conditions.location: Davis CA -- 1hr from SF, direct access to UC Davis ag robotics ecosystem, Central Valley specialty crop growers, CA food production cluster
founding_conditions.markets: US + LATAM lowest friction, any geography viable on economics

economic_force_magnitude.description: TAM x cost advantage ratio x Jevons expansion potential

structural_compounding.description: Does business get HARDER to compete with over time?

convergence_resistance.description: What prevents competitors from replicating in 3 years?

capital_efficiency.description: Structural advantage gained per dollar invested

history.weights: balanced 1.0 across: competitive_density, unit_economics_clarity, distribution_specificity, moat_durability, customer_findability
history.reason: v2 cycles 0-4 used balanced weights on sector-level scoring.

history.weights: balanced 1.0 across: competitive_density, unit_economics_clarity, distribution_specificity, moat_durability, customer_findability
history.reason: YC-granularity decomposition. Customer-segment-based scoring. PROBLEM: scored tactical accessibility, not structural durability.

history.weights: weighted: economic_force (35%), structural_compounding (25%), convergence_resistance (20%), timing_structural_fit (10%), capital_efficiency (10%)
history.reason: Architecture-based decomposition. CORRECTS Cycle 5: scores STRUCTURAL DURABILITY. Physical architectures dominate because convergence resistance from physical assets >> software.

acquire_and_modernize.description: Buy existing business at demographic-distress pricing, deploy AI+robotics. Highest convergence resistance.

full_service_replacement.description: Replace entire function (not just sell a tool). Christensen disruptive layer.

rollup_consolidation.description: Acquire-and-modernize at scale. Strongest compounding mechanism.

data_compounding.description: Service entry + data flywheel. Weak at year 1, unassailable at year 5.

regulatory_moat_builder.description: Build compliance infrastructure. Every new regulation increases value.

platform_infrastructure.description: Build once, sell many. Moderate convergence resistance.

marketplace_network.description: Network effects once at critical mass. Binary value.

arbitrage_window.description: Time-limited structural mispricing. Act during PE distress window.

physical_production_ai.description: Greenfield AI-native production. Lower than acquire-and-modernize (no inherited moats).

vertical_saas.description: LOWEST score. Easy to start but hard to defend. Platform incumbents can add features.

top_20_models.name: Full-Service AI Finance Function for SMBs

running_patterns.description: Multi-Sector Baumol Cure Convergence: Healthcare, legal, accounting, insurance all releasing stored above-CPI energy simultaneously
running_patterns.cycle_6_update: Architecture analysis reveals: the Baumol force creates opportunity for EVERY architecture type. But full-service replacement captures 5x more value than vertical SaaS because it replaces the ENTIRE function, not just a tool.

Acquire-and-modernize (84 avg) and rollup (84 avg) are the dominant architectures for this force. Silver Tsunami creates ACQUISITION SUPPLY. AI+robotics create MODERNIZATION CAPABILITY. Together they produce the highest-scoring models in the landscape.

Regulatory moat builder is now a distinct ARCHITECTURE type scoring 77 avg. Three separate plays identified: healthcare AI (250+ bills), insurance AI (NAIC model law), mental health AI (21 bills). Every new regulation increases platform value PERMANENTLY.

The LARGEST force by TAM. 70% of SMBs currently unserved by professional financial services. At 10x lower cost, market expands 3-5x from $139B to $400-600B. This is the economic force magnitude driving full-service replacement architecture.

running_patterns.description: Robotics x AI Compound Production Cost Compression
running_patterns.cycle_6_update: This force now maps to 4 distinct architectures: acquire_and_modernize, platform_infrastructure, physical_production_ai, rollup_consolidation. Architecture analysis reveals: ACQUIRE is 16 points better than BUILD (84 vs 68) because inherited moats compound.

ARCHITECTURE-LEVEL VALIDATION: Full-service replacement (79 avg) beats vertical SaaS (67 avg) by 12 points. The 12-point gap is STRUCTURAL: full-service owns the customer, vertical SaaS is a feature on someone else's platform. This is Christensen's prediction realized in scoring data.

running_patterns.description: Dead Business Revival at AI-Native Cost Structure
running_patterns.cycle_6_update: Now scored as arbitrage_window architecture. PE-distressed accounting practices (C6-AW-ACC-01, score 82) extend the pattern beyond Bench/Woebot to structural PE distress. $1.2T debt maturity wall creates 2-3 year window.

running_patterns.description: Niche Segmentation Reveals Hidden Opportunity Structure
running_patterns.cycle_6_update: Cycle 6 SUPERSEDES this pattern with architecture-based analysis. Niche segmentation was correct but incomplete. Architecture segmentation reveals that HOW you enter a market matters more than WHICH niche you target. A $149/mo full-service bookkeeping play (score 84) beats a $149/mo restaurant-specific vertical SaaS play (score 71).

running_patterns.description: NEW: Physical Architecture Dominance Over Digital
running_patterns.detail: Acquire-and-modernize (84 avg) and rollup (84 avg) outscore every software architecture. Physical assets + permits + customer contracts + favorable financing (SBA 504) create convergence resistance that software CANNOT MATCH. This was INVISIBLE in Cycle 5's tactical scoring because tactical accessibility favors software (easy to start) while structural durability favors physical (hard to compete with).

running_patterns.description: NEW: Data Compounding as Bridge to Unassailability
running_patterns.detail: The strongest SOFTWARE plays combine a service entry point with a data compounding flywheel. The service generates revenue AND data. The data creates the unassailable moat that the service alone cannot. C6-DC-FIN-01 (score 86) and C6-DC-HC-01 (score 84) both follow this pattern. Data compounding is the bridge that makes digital plays structurally defensible.

running_patterns.description: NEW: Timing for Physical, Compounding for Digital
running_patterns.detail: Physical architectures have TIMING windows (SBA fee waiver Sept 2026, Silver Tsunami peak, PE distress 2026-2028). Digital architectures have COMPOUNDING advantages (data flywheel grows every day). Optimal strategy: START with physical (capture timing window), BUILD digital in parallel (capture compounding).

opportunity_landscape.summary: Cycle 6 decomposed 8 structural forces across 10 business architecture types, producing 187 models. Architecture-based scoring with structural durability axes REVERSES Cycle 5 rankings: vertical SaaS (Cycle 5 highest tactical accessibility) scores LOWEST (67 avg). Acquire-and-modernize (Cycle 5 harder to start) scores HIGHEST (84 avg). The top models cluster by architecture: (1) Physical acquisition/rollup plays score 84 avg, (2) Full-service replacement scores 79 avg, (3) Data compounding scores 80 avg. Vertical SaaS scores 67 avg.
tier_2_models: C6-FSR-FIN-01: Full-Service AI Finance for SMBs (84)
not_recommended: C6-NR-01: Vertical SaaS Therapist Notes (45) -- Blueprint 50K clinicians, tool-layer commodity
C6-NR-03: Vertical SaaS Payroll+Bookkeeping (38) -- Gusto $746M, Rippling $1.3B
C6-NR-04: Consumer Mental Health App (35) -- saturated market
C6-NR-05: Vertical SaaS Clinical Documentation (40) -- Abridge $250M captured
C6-NR-06: Vertical SaaS Auto Claims Photo (38) -- Tractable $115M, CCC public
C6-NR-07: Vertical SaaS Shopify Bookkeeping (48) -- Finaloop $35M direct
C6-NR-08: Vertical SaaS Real Estate AI (30) -- $10.5B funding, 7 unicorns
C6-NR-09: Platform Government AI (42) -- 12-24mo procurement, Tyler Tech $1.8B
C6-NR-10: Vertical SaaS AG Irrigation (44) -- Orchard Robotics $22M, OEM risk

key_unknowns: Customer discovery interviews -- STILL TOP PRIORITY. Talk to: (a) retiring CNC shop owners, (b) specialty food producers, (c) SMB owners doing own bookkeeping, (d) healthcare AI companies about compliance burden, (e) independent practices about prior auth pain.
SBA 504 CDC relationship establishment -- TIME SENSITIVE before Sept 2026 deadline.
BizBuySell specific acquisition targets -- narrow to 5-10 CNC shops and 5-10 food producers with criteria.
Cobot integration partner in CA -- Standard Bots vs UR vs FANUC for specific shop configurations.
Data compounding feasibility -- can aggregated SMB financial data be productized while maintaining privacy?
Regulatory moat builder competitive landscape -- any funded players specifically building multi-state healthcare AI compliance?
PE distress timeline -- when do first forced sales from $1.2T maturity wall appear?
Manufacturing acquisition operational playbook -- what does the first 90 days post-acquisition look like?
next_cycle_suggestions: PRIORITY 1: Customer discovery interviews -- 5+ conversations with retiring CNC/food production owners via BizBuySell.
PRIORITY 2: SBA 504 CDC relationship -- contact Statewide CDC, model specific acquisition capital stack.
PRIORITY 3: Narrow BizBuySell targets to 5-10 specific CNC shops and 5-10 food producers.
PRIORITY 4: Standard Bots / UR partnership exploration for cobot deployment.
PRIORITY 5: Architecture sequencing plan -- physical FIRST (timing window), digital PARALLEL (compounding).
PRIORITY 6: Prototype specification for C6-FSR-FIN-01 (full-service finance) or C6-RMB-HC-01 (compliance platform).
